channel.title: Projects on Kris Wu's Humble Site
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Kris Wu's Humble Site

item.title: Covid death rates by gender, co-morbidities, and ICU admission
item.description: The UK’s 3rd nation-wide pandemics lockdown is scheduled 14th October. It will be very unfortunate to get infected the virus, especially that a cold winter is approaching. Let’s look at the likelihood of death if you get them. The point is not to scare you, but to warn you to be careful!!! Load data packages Download and clean data frame # URL link to CDC to download data url <- "https://data.

item.title: Guess which country drinks the most alcohol
item.description: I was talking to a German friend one day about how good German are at drinking alcohol, he said “the Chinese moutai is nothing”. While taste is kind of personal, I did not feel offended as we were drinking and telling nonsense as well. That was back in Denmark where student orientations typically have challenge activities such as drinking 6 litres of beer. Now, I am intrigued to find out how nationals of different countries love beer, spirits or wine.

item.title: Movie gross and ratings
item.description: Load the data packages library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(fivethirtyeight) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(vroom) library(tidyquant) library(rvest) # scrape websites library(purrr) library(lubridate) #to handle dates Load data and take a look movies <- read_csv(here::here("data", "movies.csv")) glimpse(movies) ## Rows: 2,961 ## Columns: 11 ## $ title <chr> "Avatar", "Titanic", "Jurassic World", "The Aveng… ## $ genre <chr> "Action", "Drama", "Action", "Action", "Action", … ## $ director <chr> "James Cameron", "James Cameron", "Colin Trevorro… ## $ year <dbl> 2009, 1997, 2015, 2012, 2008, 1999, 1977, 2015, 2… ## $ duration <dbl> 178, 194, 124, 173, 152, 136, 125, 141, 164, 93, … ## $ gross <dbl> 7.

item.title: Return of Stocks
item.description: As a finance student, it is interesting to look at time series data and decide which index to invest. We shall see, for this page, how the NYSE-listed stocks performed. Load data packages library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(fivethirtyeight) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(vroom) library(tidyquant) library(rvest) # scrape websites library(purrr) library(lubridate) #to handle dates Load data nyse <- read_csv(here::here("data","nyse.csv")) First, it is a good practice to see what example industries the stocks belong to.
